question_stem: The graph of \(y = g(x)\) is shown below. It passes through the points \((-2, 1)\), \((0, -1)\) and \((3, 2)\).

parts.question_text: State the coordinates of the corresponding points on the graph of \(y = -2g(x)\).
parts.solution_text:
The transformation \(y = -2g(x)\) represents a stretch parallel to the y-axis by a scale factor of 2, followed by a reflection in the x-axis.

For the point \((-2, 1)\) on \(y = g(x)\), the corresponding point on \(y = -2g(x)\) is \((-2, -2(1))\) which simplifies to \((-2, -2)\).

For the point \((0, -1)\) on \(y = g(x)\), the corresponding point on \(y = -2g(x)\) is \((0, -2(-1))\) which simplifies to \((0, 2)\).

For the point \((3, 2)\) on \(y = g(x)\), the corresponding point on \(y = -2g(x)\) is \((3, -2(2))\) which simplifies to \((3, -4)\).
